articles.author: John Revill, Emma Farge
articles.description: World leaders gather in Switzerland on Saturday for a summit aimed at pressuring Russia to end its war in Ukraine, but the absence of powerful allies of Moscow such as China will blunt its potential impact.
articles.title: World leaders join Ukraine summit in test of Kyiv's diplomatic clout

articles.author: Nidal Al-Mughrabi, James Mackenzie
articles.description: Eight Israeli soldiers were killed in the southern Gaza Strip on Saturday, the military said, as forces continued to push in and around the southern city of Rafah and strikes hit several areas of Gaza, killing at least 19 Palestinians.
articles.title: Eight Israeli soldiers killed as fighting continues in Rafah

articles.author: Crispian Balmer
articles.description: Since taking office in 2022, Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni has proved a pragmatic partner on major international issues, assuaging fears she would be a dogmatic conservative unwilling to compromise.
articles.title: Italy's Meloni shows her arch-conservative credentials at G7 summit

articles.author: Tassilo Hummel, Gleb Stolyarov, Polina, Nikolskaya, David Gauthier-Villars
articles.description: Nike stopped selling its sportswear to Russia soon after Moscow launched its full-scale invasion of Ukraine over two years ago. But that hasn’t stopped footballstore.ru, an online sports retailer owned by Russia’s Zenit soccer club.
articles.title: The Dutchman who gets Nike and Lego into wartime Russia’s stores

articles.author: Felix Hoske, John Revill
articles.description: Svitlana Bilous travelled half way across Europe - from her home in Ukraine to a Swiss mountaintop resort - to stand on the sidelines of an international peace summit on Saturday and tell the world about her missing husband.
articles.title: Ukrainian families cross Europe to plead for prisoners held by Russia

articles.author: Niklas Pollard, Johan Ahlander
articles.description: Sweden and Iran carried out a prisoner exchange on Saturday, officials said, with Sweden freeing a former Iranian official convicted for his role in a mass execution in the 1980s while Iran released two Swedes being held there.
articles.title: Sweden and Iran exchange prisoners in breakthrough deal

articles.author: Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: Demonstrations were expected in Paris and several other French cities on Saturday to protest against the far-right National Rally's (RN) surge in last Sunday's European elections.
articles.title: Thousands to march across France against far right

articles.author: David Milliken
articles.description: Kate, Britain's Princess of Wales, arrived at Buckingham Palace on Saturday ahead of her first public appearance since surgery five months ago revealed the presence of cancer.
articles.title: Kate, Princess of Wales, arrives for first public appearance since cancer diagnosis

articles.author: Joe Bavier
articles.description: For the first time since Nelson Mandela negotiated an end to white minority rule, former sworn enemies are coming together in South Africa under a pledge to overcome ideological differences for the good of the nation.
articles.title: South African foes unite in uneasy coalition

articles.author: John Revill
articles.description: Russia's abduction of Ukrainian children is an attempt to steal the country's future and has left the youngsters with deep psychological scars, campaigners from Ukraine said on Saturday as they called for international efforts to bring them home.
articles.title: Ukrainian children abducted by Russia left with psychological scars, campaigners say
